es.eurohelp.lod.aldapa.core

Class Manager

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.eurohelp.lod.aldapa.core.Manager

  • public class Manager
extends Object
    Main entry-point for the ALDAPA API. A manager is responsible for creating projects and executing pipelines
    Author:
    Mikel Egana Aranguren, Eurohelp Consulting S.L.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Manager

        public Manager(ConfigurationManager configuredconfigmanager)
        throws ClassNotFoundException,
               InstantiationException,
               IllegalAccessException,
               ConfigurationException
        Parameters:
        configuredconfigmanager - an already configured ConfigurationManger, holding the necessary configuration
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - the plugin class was not found
        IllegalAccessException - illegal access
        InstantiationException - the plugin class could not be instantiated
        ConfigurationException - the configuration is incomplete

    • Method Detail

      • addProject

        public String addProject(String project_name)
                  throws ProjectExistsException,
                         IOException,
                         RDFStoreException,
                         URISyntaxException,
                         ConfigurationException
        Adds a new project
        Parameters:
        project_name - the name of the new project that will be used to generate the project URI, according to the configuration
        Returns:
        the URI of the newly added project
        Throws:
        IOException - an input/output exception
        RDFStoreException - a problem with the RDF Store
        URISyntaxException - the URI is wrong
        ConfigurationException - the configuration is incomplete
        ProjectExistsException

      • flushGraph

        public void flushGraph(String graphuri,
                       String fileName)
                throws RDFStoreException,
                       IOException
        Write a Graph into a file
        Parameters:
        graphuri - the Named Graph URI, it can be null
        fileName - the path of the file to wrtie the graph to
        Throws:
        RDFStoreException - a problem with the RDF Store
        IOException - an input/output exception

      • addCatalog

        public String addCatalog(String catalog_name,
                         String project_uri)
                  throws CatalogExistsException,
                         IOException,
                         RDFStoreException,
                         ProjectNotFoundException,
                         URISyntaxException,
                         ConfigurationException
        Adds a new catalog in a project. See model/default-model.trig for details
        Parameters:
        catalog_name - the name of the new catalog that will be used to generate the URI, according to the configuration
        project_uri - the project that this catalog belongs to
        Returns:
        Catalog URI
        Throws:
        CatalogExistsException - the catalog already exists
        IOException - an input/output exception
        RDFStoreException - a problem with the RDF Store
        ProjectNotFoundException - the project could not be found
        URISyntaxException - the dataset could not be found
        ConfigurationException - the configuration is incomplete

      • addDataset

        public String addDataset(String dataset_name,
                         String catalog_uri)
                  throws DatasetExistsException,
                         IOException,
                         RDFStoreException,
                         CatalogNotFoundException,
                         URISyntaxException,
                         ConfigurationException
        Adds a new dataset in a catalog. See model/default-model.trig for details
        Parameters:
        dataset_name - the name of the new dataset that will be used to generate the URI, according to the configuration
        catalog_uri - the catalog that this dataset belongs to
        Returns:
        Dataset URI
        Throws:
        DatasetExistsException - the dataset already exists
        IOException - an input/output exception
        RDFStoreException - a problem with the RDF Store
        CatalogNotFoundException - the catalog could not be found
        URISyntaxException - the URI is wrong
        ConfigurationException - the configuration is incomplete

      • addNamedGraph

        public String addNamedGraph(String graph_name,
                            String dataset_uri)
                     throws IOException,
                            RDFStoreException,
                            URISyntaxException,
                            ConfigurationException,
                            DatasetNotFoundException,
                            NamedGraphExistsException
        Adds the metadata associated to a named graph that will hold actual data. See model/default-model.trig for details
        Parameters:
        graph_name - the name for the named graph
        dataset_uri - the URI of the dataset that this named graph belongs to
        Returns:
        the URI for the named graph
        Throws:
        IOException - an input/output exception
        RDFStoreException - a problem with the RDF Store
        URISyntaxException - the URI is wrong
        ConfigurationException - the configuration is incomplete
        DatasetNotFoundException - the dataset could not be found
        NamedGraphExistsException - the Named Graph already exists

      • addDataToNamedGraph

        public void addDataToNamedGraph(String namedGraphURI,
                                String csv_path)
                         throws IOException,
                                RDFStoreException
        Adds data to a named graph, by executing the registered transformation plugin. See model/default-model.trig for details
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - the named Graph URI that will store the data
        csv_path - the path CSV file with Open Data
        Throws:
        IOException - an input/output exception
        RDFStoreException - a problem with the RDF Store

      • deleteProject

        public void deleteProject(String project_URI)
                   throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Delete a project. This will delete a project and all its metadata (Catalogs, Datasets etc.) and the data within its dataset
        Parameters:
        project_URI - the project URI
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - This functionality has not been implemented yet
